titleStmt.title: Ad eos qui Authorem pro novatore sunt habituri.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Ad eos qui Authorem pro novatore sunt habituri.

monogr.title: Five pious and learned discourses : 1. A sermon shewing how we ought to behave our selves in Gods house. 2. A sermon preferring holy charity before faith, hope, and knowledge. 3. A treatise shewing that Gods law, now qualified by the Gospel of Christ, is possible, and ought to be fulfilled of us in this life. 4. A treatise of the divine attributes. 5. A treatise shewing the Antichrist not to be yet come. By Robert Shelford of Ringsfield in Suffolk priest
monogr.author: Shelford, Robert

div.head: Ad eos qui Authorem pro novatore sunt habituri.
div.l: NOn nova fert veterum satur; at provectior annis
Scit, veterum facies queis fuit, esse nova.
